CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Here , the atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was applied to investigate the morphology of the blend film of the polymer : PC 70 BM fabricated from CB and DCB solutions , respectively , as shown in Fig.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PC 70 BM |
| CB |
| DCB |

Explanation:

* PC 70 BM: It is mentioned as a blend film of the polymer.
* CB: It is mentioned as one of the solutions from which the blend film is fabricated.
* DCB: It is also mentioned as one of the solutions from which the blend film is fabricated.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PC 70 BM |

Explanation:

* PC 70 BM: It is the only clear material name mentioned in the paragraph as a blend film of the polymer.
* CB and DCB are mentioned as solutions, but not as materials.

Paragraph: Here , the atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was applied to investigate the morphology of the blend film of the polymer : PC 70 BM fabricated from CB and DCB solutions , respectively , as shown in Fig.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| AFM |
| blend film of the polymer: PC 70 BM |

In this paragraph, the "Property Value" entities refer to specific scientific terms and materials used in the investigation. These entities include "AFM" which stands for Atomic Force Microscopy, a type of microscopy used to investigate the morphology of materials. The "blend film of the polymer: PC 70 BM" is another entity, which refers to a specific type of film made from a polymer called PC 70 BM. The "CB" and "DCB" entities refer to the solvents used to fabricate the blend film, specifically CB (Carbon disulfide, Cyclohexanone) and DCB (1,2-Dichlorobenzene).
